title: Introduction to JSON
content: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format that is easy to read and write.

title: Why Use JSON?
content: JSON is widely used for data exchange because it is language-independent and easy to parse.

title: JSON Syntax Rules
content: JSON uses key-value pairs, arrays, and objects. Keys must be strings, and values can be strings, numbers, arrays, or other objects.

title: Working with JSON in JavaScript
content: JavaScript provides methods like JSON.parse() and JSON.stringify() to work with JSON data.

title: REST APIs and JSON
content: Most modern web APIs use JSON to send and receive data between clients and servers.

title: Parsing JSON in Python
content: Python has a built-in JSON module that allows parsing and manipulating JSON data with ease.

title: JSON vs XML
content: JSON is simpler and more lightweight compared to XML, making it the preferred choice for many applications.

title: JSON Data Types
content: JSON supports strings, numbers, objects, arrays, booleans, and null values.

title: JSON Schema
content: JSON Schema defines the structure of JSON data and is used for validation.

title: Handling JSON Errors
content: JSON parsers often throw errors if the syntax is incorrect, so always validate JSON before use.

title: Nested JSON Objects
content: JSON allows nesting objects within objects, making it flexible for complex data structures.

title: JSON and Local Storage
content: Web browsers support storing JSON data in localStorage for client-side persistence.

title: Fetching JSON from APIs
content: Using fetch() in JavaScript, you can retrieve JSON data from an API.

title: Serializing JSON in Python
content: Python’s json.dumps() method converts Python objects into JSON strings.

title: Working with Large JSON Files updated 2
content: For large JSON files, use streaming parsers or databases optimized for JSON storage.

title: Minifying JSON
content: JSON can be minified by removing unnecessary whitespace, reducing file size.

title: Pretty Printing JSON
content: Pretty-printing JSON makes it easier to read by formatting it with indentation.

title: Converting JSON to CSV
content: JSON data can be converted to CSV for use in spreadsheets and data analysis.

title: JSON Web Tokens (JWT)
content: JWT is a JSON-based standard for creating access tokens used in authentication.

title: GraphQL vs JSON REST APIs
content: GraphQL provides more flexibility than traditional JSON REST APIs by allowing clients to specify the data they need.

title: Online learning is better than classroom learning. Do you agree or disagree
content: In recent years online class has been a pillar of children's education, this was caused by world-wide lock down due corona virus. This led to massive use of online learning, which has brought up questions whether online learning is good or bad. I agree to the goodness of online in the following areas.
